title: Can’t believe we were really here!!!
text: The Acropolis is breathtaking. The fact that something is so old and so well preserved and that we could explore all around it was mind boggling. Our hotel had a view of the Acropolis and the view at night was stunning. Everywhere in the city you only had to look up and be amazed.

title: The perrrrrfect foodie tour of Athens with AFT and Georgia
text: I can still hear Georgia Kalimeri and her perfectly rolled rrrrrrrs telling us what a perfect group we were and how perrrfect (keep rolling the rs, you get the point) our donuts and coffees and teas and saffron purchases and olives, cheeses and breads and ice creams were that we enjoyed that day. It truly was a perfect way to experience the local Athenian market and see and taste how fresh and delicious their foods are. Georgia’s enthusiasm for her work and her pride in her city and culture were infectious and we felt like we were more than tourists, we were Greeks enjoying the sights, sound and foods of “our” city. She in fact called us “her people.” (“My people, come tp me! You’ll love this; it is perfect!”) This was one of our favorite parts of our holiday in Greece all because of Georgia and her delightful zest for life, people, food and fun. This is a “must”. and Georgia was our very own muse.

title: Lovely hotel in the heart of the Acropolis area
text: We spent three nights at the Hera Hotel this week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is boutique style and the staff are warm and accommodating and English speaking as a bonus. Our Jr suite had a king size bed and a balcony with a view of the Acropolis, as did the Peacock lounge on the top floor where we enjoyed happy hours drinks and a snack. The breakfast buffet is very nice and the wait staff were especially helpful in teaching us some Greek words. The hotel is centrally located near fine tavernas and attractions. Loved it!

title: Beautiful Southern home and formal gardens on the Ashley River
text: The azaleas were exploding with color during our visit to Middleton earlier this month. And we couldn't walk near a body of water without seeing an alligator, or two, or three, basking on the sunny banks. They left us alone and we did the same to them. But how cool to see them enjoying such a beautiful place. The house tour is informative and the home itself is beautiful. The highlights of the estate are the many garden and pond areas with beautiful formal gardens as well as meadows and park settings. Absolutely gorgeous afternoon. Will definitely visit again!

title: Amazing rooftop bar with the best view of Charleston's riverfront.
text: We love this bar on the roof of the Pavilion Hotel. We've sat huddled around their propane heaters in the winter and basked under the moon on warm evenings in spring with fabulous drinks and an unbeatable view. A must see for Rooftop bar fans!

title: 70 homemade flavors of ice-cream.....what else can you say?!
text: We LOVE this ice cream parlor. Anna is the sweetest person in the world and makes you feel so at home as she piles large scoops of ice cream into cups, cones and shakes. Name a flavor and she probably has it...we love the coconut, butter pecan and the chocolate dipped waffle cones with nuts and pretzels on them. Their homemade ice cream birthday cakes are also delicious. Such a treat to bring visiting friends here. Everyone always loves it.

title: The home of gorgeous Gullah art and prints
text: Being new to the lowcountry, I'd seen Gullah art in various homes and shops and read about Jonathon Green and his famous Gullah art work. We sought out the Gallery Chuma in the Charleston city market and were assisted by Zachary who was so knowledgeable and helpful. He showed us piece after piece of Gullah art and knew the stories behind them. He helped us select 3 prints by Mr. Green and John Jones for our home. They were having a wonderful sale on prints, with frames included, when we were there and we feel like we got a great deal. Makes me wish I had more wall space in our house.

title: Wine and Cheese Pairing with Stephane was one of the highlights of our trip
text: Who knew pairing wine with cheese could be so much fun and informative. Our group of 8 spent 3 hours in the beautiful stone basement dining room at LeFoodist and enjoyed the finest champagne, Sancerre, St. Emilion reds paired perfectly with delicious cheeses and french bread. Stephane was entertaining and cordial, knowledgeable and funny. We laughed and learned so much. If your a foodie or simply love a really good glass of wine and delicious French cheese, call Fred at LeFoodist and sign up for this culinary treat.

title: Outdoor dining right off the beach, what's not to love?!!!
text: We brought friends here February 7 and it was a gorgeous 65 degree day in Pawleys Island. We sat outdoors in the sun and drank draft beers while we waited for our meals. The crab cake over succotash was delicious, and being from Maryland, I'm kind of a crab cake snob, but this was so tasty. The Cabana burger was big and juicy and perfectly cooked. The bronzed grouper and fried grouper baskets were also good choices. The fish was fresh, the batter was light and crispy and the cole slaw and fries were tasty too. A good choice for a casual lunch on the beach.

title: Another wonderful meal at Cru Cafe!
text: Cru Cafe is quickly becoming one of favorite restaurants in Charleston. We were celebrating the birthday of a friend who'd not been to Charleston before who wanted something "traditionally Southern" but quirky and fun. Cru was perfect. Katie was our wonderful waitress who was hospitable, knowledgeable and oh so fun. We started out the meal with Fried Green Tomatoes, of course! and some fat and fresh white wine truffled Mussels complete with delicious bread for dipping in the sauce. Our entrees included the thai seafood risotto, parmesan potato gnocchi, braised lamb shanks and the red snapper fish of the day and each dish was perfectly prepared and enjoyed. Katie was helpful with picking our sparkling wine and other drink choices and she was attentive to our request for a birthday dessert for my friend...a flourless chocolate torte complete with a candle. It was a fabulous celebration and we'll definitely be back!

title: Delicious breakfast and the BEST Bloody Marys!
text: My husband and I had brunch here two weeks ago and I'm still talking about the Bloody Marys....oh my word...they are spicy and fabulous and came with A SLICE OF BACON in it...everything is better with bacon, right?! Our crab benedicts were fresh and delicious and huge...the grits were so tasty and the coffee hot and fresh. Our server was polite and helpful in making suggestions and it was just a great start to a day touring the Holy City.

title: Delicious seafood and our new favorite shrimp and grits in town
text: My husband and I dined here last week and had a wonderful meal. Jeff orders shrimp and grits in every restaurant in Charleston determined to find the best....High Cotton is his new favorite. Creamy grits with lots of juice to dip bread in and huge, fresh and flavorful shrimp. We started our meal with baked oysters and they were large and delicious. I had the fish special for that evening. A whole snapper, served bone in, perfectly flaky and fresh served with a wonderful sauce. We shared bowls of broccolini and roasted brussel sprouts...try them even if you're not a fan of brussel sprouts, they were so tasty. We split a coconut cream pie for dessert...with a coconut crust, yum! We already made reservations to go back over New Years. The atmosphere is lovely and cozy and we had an excellent table in the window. Can't say enough good things about it. Enjoy!

title: Le Foodist made us feel very French and very competent in the kitchen....EXCELLENT class!
text: Our group of 10 took the Paris metro from the Arc to Le Foodist (which was a fun adventure in itself) and arrived 15 minutes late to our appoiintment. Fred, our chef said "no problem, you're on Paris time" so we immediately felt comfortable. After coffee, Fred explained we'd be touring the market area to purchase food that we would come back and prepare for our lunch. Fred is extremely knowledgeable about Paris, French cooking, fresh foods, especially the cheeses, and our tour was so informative and fun. After about 45 minutes we headed back to Le Foodist where he broke us into pairs of two to prepare our meal. Mussels marinieres, gratin dauphinois (to die for potatoes!), coq au vin and poire belle helene (pears in chocolate sauce). Fred showed us how to chop more efficiently, how to make a wine reduction sauce that you could eat with a spoon as a meal, and how to cook chicken by sous vide (boiling it in saran wrap, amaziing!) The entire cooking class was 6 hours, including our amazing lunch that we feasted on with good wines and excellent conversation. I can't recommend this experience enough. It's a wonderful taste, literally, of French cooking and the professional kitchen with it's induction cooktops was clean, orderly and so accessible. We felt like Julia Childs. Fred is an excellent teacher and his staff was very helpful and accommodating. GO and you will not regret it. Such a wonderful memory for our group.
place: Paris Cooking Class including 3-Course Lunch, Wine & Optional Market Visit

title: Delicious pizza, great atmosphere and service
text: Date night with the hubs and we chose Laurienzo's because we love the pizza. Hot and fresh and right out of the brick oven and covered in yummy sauce, fresh veggies, grilled chicken and mozzarella, what's not to love?? Good wine selection too. We went at 8:30 pm and had a cozy corner table and it was nice and quiet. Always a favorite and never disappointed.

title: Home cooked goodness
text: Four of us had a delicious lunch of shrimp and grits (so creamy and perfectly spiced.), the fish specials (so fresh), sweet deviled eggs and amazing desserts. The strawberry shortcake and chocolate pecan pie were especially delicious. The atmosphere is quaint, the service was great and the prices are reasonable. Such a great meal. We’,, be back again.

title: Enzo and his staff created a lasting heirloom and treasure from our trip to Positano
text: I've never gone on vacation overseas and purchased furniture, I mean, who does that? LOL But when we were looking in Positano for a beautiful ceramic piece to take home as a souvenir of that beautiful place, our travel agent sent us to Emporio della Ceramica and the wonderful Enzo. We scoured every inch of his beautiful two level showroom and kept coming back to the beautiful 42 inch painted lava table tops. We thought, this will be a FOREVER souvenir we will actually use everyday in our new beach home. Enzo spent over an hour with us discussing the ways we could customize it and set about to setting up delivery, etc. He threw in a lovely tile that said "Villa Herwig" for our new home. It took 4 months to get the table delivered to SC but we had told Enzo we didn't need it before Christmas so we were fine waiting until later. One of the table legs was broken, which was hard to believe considering how sturdily everything was crated and wrapped. It was a several hundred pound delivery, but Enzo quickly had a new table frame shipped to us. He was always quick to respond to our inquiries and the resulting piece is nothing short of stunning! My husband had ordered a matching water much to my surprise and it too is a masterpiece. Thank you to Enzo and your amazing artisans. Should we find ourselves back in Positano, we'll be back in your shop.

title: Delicious sandwiches, olive oils and the sweetest staff on Positano
text: We SEARCHED for this delicatessen after seeing photographs of it on Facebook on the blog Cupcakes and Chaos. It looked so darling with all the flowers cascading down its steps that we couldn't wait to find it. We were so enchanted by the proprietor and her staff as they helped us peruse all the lovely choices for lunch and to select just the right olive oils to take home for gifts. The food was delicious as were the selection of oils we brought back. GO and visit this lovely deli and store. You won't be sorry.

title: The mansion is even more stunning than the gardens, which I thought would be impossible.
text: My husband and I traveled back to Hillwood Museum and Gardens this past glorious weekend in DC and toured the mansion which had not previously done. The guided tour was so interesting and the mansion is filled to bursting with portraits, beautiful porcelain, statues and elegant furnishings. The dining room is stunning and I so wanted to sit at the elaborate table and enjoy a meal in the gorgeous setting. Marjorie Merriwether Post was a fascinating woman and her collection of Russian artifacts going back to the Czars is so impressive. There are two beautiful Faberge eggs among her collection of jeweled porcelains and they do not disappoint. We were told there only 50 produced, and she owned 2 of them. Allow yourself extra time to go through the mansion on your own after your tour to see up close all the extravagant pieces in the glass cases. And again we enjoyed a picnic lunch on the gorgeous terrace overlooking the sloping lawn. Bring a picnic and a bottle of champagne and toast Marjorie for donating this beautiful collection for all of us to enjoy!

title: Tender, tasty barbecue!!
text: Loved our recent meal at Moe's. The rib meat was fall-off-the-bone tender and their sauces are delicious. Try the roasted turkey with the white sauce, yum! The macaroni and cheese and greens sides were very good too.

title: Fresh baked EVERYTHING and it's all so delicious!!!!
text: Go on a Thursday or Friday morning and buy a loaf of the raisin bread and life will seem so much better.

title: Fresh tasty sushi and BYOB...what's not to love?!
text: We've been coming to Yamahana for years and I'm long overdue in writing a review. The sushi here is always fresh and tasty. They have a huge menu or fresh rolls plus selections of teriyaki meals with salmon or chicken etc. The rolls are always beautifully prepared and super fresh. We love that it's BYOB and we've spent many nights sharing some wine and some delicious sushi. The chefs and staff are professional and friendly.

title: One of our favorite restaurants in Fort Lauderdale
text: This is one of our "go to" restaurants every time we visit Fort Lauderdale. There's something for everyone. When our kids were little we ate outside on the deck so they could watch and feed the huge tarpon that swim around right next to your tables. This time around we ate upstairs and indoors and had a table by the window with beautiful views of the intercoastal and the bridge. The signature cocktails were very tasty and our appetizer of crab claws was expensive, but really delicious. Our main dishes were fresh seafood ranging from fish to scallops and steaks too. Everyone was perfectly prepared and served by friendly attentive waitstaff. Next time we're in Fort Lauderdale, we'll be back.

title: Beautiful, modern hotel hidden away just a block from the beach
text: Our first trip to Key West was fabulous due in great part to this gem of a hotel. We stayed in a ground floor two bedroom suite right near the hotel pool. The amenities are lovely. The rooms are beautiful, the beds comfortable, the kitchen and sitting areas are lovely and the hotel is so quiet! We enjoyed happy hour everyday at the pool with sangria, wine and specialty drinks and snacks. The sushi restaurant that is adjoining the hotel is fab!! Such fresh fish and wonderful sushi combinations. We were just two blocks off Duvall Street but felt like we were miles away because it was so nice and secluded on our block. We could walk to the Butterfly museum, the southernmost point and all the great bars and restaurants and then return to our hotel for a swim and cocktails. Such a great place! Ken and the rest of the staff in the front office were so helpful and accommodating. They set up some great dinner reservations and tours for us. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

title: Beautiful butterflies, flowers and birds all under one roof
text: We spent a lovely hour or two looking at all the amazing butterflies, birds and flowers that filled the conservatory. The pink flamingos were especially fun to watch too. Some folks were covered in butterflies! They seem to like blue shirts, fyi. The gift shop is large and filled with some lovely, artsy pieces.
place: Key West Butterfly and Nature Conservatory

title: Beautiful, historic home with such fascinating history
text: We spent a fun afternoon at the Ernest Hemingway house and gardens. We had a fabulous guide, whose name I forget sadly, who knew absolutely everything about Hemingway, the furniture, the history of the city and the house...he was great! The gardens are lovely and the story about the pool and the penny is great and not to be missed. This is a must see. The 6-toed cats are friendly and very likely to pounce in your lap.
place: The Ernest Hemingway Home and Museum

title: Great place to unwind with a drink at night
text: We had a delicious dinner and great drinks at the Sunset Pier. We were on a quest for Coconut Shrimp and found it here and it was delicious! The tables are all outside and there was a beautiful breeze and live music. We arrived after sunset but I imagine this is the place to be for a beautiful sunset...will have to come back to see it from this vantage point

title: Beautiful flowers and gardens and amazing trees right off the beach
text: We wandered in here on a Sunday morning and were treated to beautiful orchids, towering trees and flowers, plants and cacti of every kind. There are lovely paths that run along the beach and the canopy of trees over the garden gives cool shade. It's a delightful place and a must see in my book.

title: Wonderful breakfast/brunch menu
text: We had delicious French roast coffee, eggs benedict, omelets, waffles, savory crepes and so many other delicious foods here for breakfast. We had a great table upstairs in the corner away from the crowd that lines up outside. You won't be sorry,

title: Funky bar with amazing mile high key lime pie and hurricanes
text: We walked into Blue Heaven on a whim to get out of the heat and have a drink after walking all of Duvall Street. What a fun, funky place. Wandering roosters, a rooster cemetary, party lights and a ping pong table are among the fun things you find here. The key lime pie is delicious and piles high with meringue. The drinks were strong and icy cold. So good. This was one of our favorite bars in Key West. We heard the food is good, but only had dessert and drinks when we visited. Loved it.

title: Food truck eating at its spicy best!
text: We followed our friends down darkened streets looking for "the fish taco truck" and were so excited to find it in all its shiny airstream glory. The fish tacos are spicy and delicious. The food was amazing. We were able to get a table under the lights on the patio near the bar, Grunts, that shares space here. You MUST eat here if you like fresh fish with a little or a lot of heat!

title: Such a disappointment....and expensive
text: Four of us came to dine here with high hopes and only one of us really had a decent meal. My homemade pasta dish with truffle sauce was truly delicious and reminded me of the fresh pasta and sauce I tasted in Italy last fall. My friends were not so lucky. Our pate appetizer was too tiny for two to share, as was most of the food offerings. The waitress warned us the portions were "European" in size, but we didn't think we'd leave hungry. My friend who ordered short ribs had four literal BITES of meat on top of a smear of potato. The poor guy was so hungry. None of the other entrees were distinguishable except that they were all expensive and very small portions. The setting is pretty and we were in the courtyard on a nice evening. Our waitress was rather rude and left us for long periods of time. If you go here, get the pasta, but I can't say I'd go back.

title: Excellent tour of the mangroves and aqua blue waters
text: We had a wonderful 3 hour kayak tour through the mangroves and across crystal clear aqua waters on this tour. We saw pelicans nesting in trees not 25 feet from us. Our tour guide was wonderful and she found shells and rays to show us in the water. Great trip....don't miss it.

title: We ate an entire key lime pie from here in one night!
text: This was our favorite key lime pie in Key West, a close second was the one served at Blue Heaven. This pie is tart and oh so lime filled! So so good....buy a whole pie...you won't be sorry and it will save you from having to come back here twice.

title: Great lunch, service, bloody Mary's and more....
text: We heard the steel drums playing as we approached and found a table right near the stage for lunch. We were meant to be here. My friend LOVES bloody marys and was tickled by the Bloody Mary bar where she could add all the liquor, juices and such that she wanted. My margarita was strong and cold and our husband's various rum concoctions were delicious. We enjoyed a wonderful lunch of fresh shrimp, salads and burgers. The key lime pie is also very good. We had a delightful lunch here. Would definitely to back again.

title: Our favorite restaurant in Pawleys Island
text: We are new homeowners on Pawleys and are thrilled to have such a wonderful restaurant just two miles down the road. Our neighbors are "regulars" here and we will be too. The fried oyster and fried green tomato appetizer is huge and so full of flavor and goodness!! The fish is always amazing and fresh and served with the most wonderful side dishes. We've never made it to dessert because the food is so filling and delicious. There is a good wine list and some very tasty signature cocktails too. The wait staff is friendly and so knowledgeable...ask them about their favorite dishes.

title: Our new favorite place in Litchfield Beach
text: Quigleys is such a fun and tasty place for drinks and dinner. They have a great selection of fresh brewed craft beer and local offerings too. The food is fresh and delicious. Their Shepherd's Pie is out of this world...big chunks of tender lamb, so good. The salads, burger's, shrimp and grits are all delicious. They have some great specials during the week too including growler discounts, happy hours and more.

title: Don't see why there's a line for this
text: So everybody lines up for a block to take a picture of this thing. If you stand in the street with your camera, you can take a selfie with it and skip the line...ok, so it wasn't THE southernmost point...close enough.

title: Old world beauty to take your breath away
text: We visited here in September 2016 with a tour group and this was one of my favorite places on our trip. The antique cobblestones and stone buildings are so beautiful and quaint. The winding streets are romantic and filled with sights, shops and delicious foods. We bought beautiful Italian made ties and belts in Siena and had delicious ice cream at Grom's. The cathedral and the many historic buildings could occupy you for weeks. I hope to come back here and explore more of Siena

title: A fabulous evening in the wine cellar despite some disappointment from the kitchen
text: This is a hard review to write. My husband and I have been coming to Antrim, and bringing dozens of people here, for the past 20 years. This past weekend we hosted a wine dinner for 6 couples in their fabulous wine cellar. It was gorgeous in there....crystal, flowers, good friends, great wine selections by Greg and wonderful service and conversation from our servers Sarah and Alicia...all the makings of a perfect night. The food was disappointing...mostly because there wasn't much of it. I know the trend is less food, more creativity and quality, farm to table etc, etc., but one shouldn't leave a 6 course meal hungry. We were huge Michael Gettier fans while he was at Antrim and we enjoyed Spencer Wolf's menu for the most part but this was a big change from what we've become accustomed. From the miniscule, although tasty hand-passed hors d'oeuvres during cocktails, to the miniature amuse bouche (I know it's just a taste, but this was hardly a nibble and only left you wanting something substantive). I remember getting a beautifully prepared oyster or shrimp on Chef Michael Gettier's watch. My fried shrimp appetizer was tasty but the shrimp were small and the slaw that accompanied it was a teaspoon's worth. The lobster bisque was well done and my filet was perfectly cooked but accompanied only by a smear of potatoes. My husband wasn't excited by his salmon appetizer or his lamb entree...again, tasty food but too creative and not enough for that price. We loved spending time in the pub and on the outdoor deck after dinner with drinks and cigars. The rooms in the mansion are wonderful, love that there's no TV, and the steam showers and fireplaces are lovely touches. The breakfast tray was fine in the morning, the muffins weren't as good as they used to be sadly. The hot breakfast was tasty but nothing special. The bacon and fried potatoes were good (oh how I miss the mixture of sweet and white breakfast potatoes Antrim used to swerve!) The egg and cheese frittatta was pretty bland and not cheesy. Our server kept the hot coffee flowing so that was a plus! Again, there are 100 things I love about Antrim, and I will be definitely be back to spend a night, but I may not be dining here anytime soon and that saddens me.

title: The gardens are amazing!
text: Who knew such a beautiful home and gardens was tucked away in Silver Spring MD? Had our first (of many to come!) visit to Hillwood this weekend on a perfect fall day, sunny and mild. The grounds of Hillwood are so beautiful to walk and wander through. We were advised to bring a picnic and enjoyed eating overlooking the terrace and the greens. There are wonderful little places to sit on Ms. Merriweather's outdoor furniture, or bring a blanket and enjoy the lovely lawns. The Japanese garden with its fountains is so beautiful and relaxing. The rose garden still had plenty of beautiful blooms in mid October and the forest walk is enchanting. Sadly we spent so much time outside that we have to come back to tour the inside of this beautiful place. Can't wait!!!!

title: So glad to have found this deli on the way to DC
text: We used trip advisor and found this very popular deli on our way to visit Hillwood Estate in Silver Spring, MD. What a fabulous carry out lunch we enjoyed! The turkey and brie with cranberry sauce is Thanksgiving day between bread...delicious. The grilled Reuben sandwich was packed with the most tasty and tender corned beef...these are hearty sandwiches! We could have shared one, but I was grateful to have the leftovers for lunch the next day. You can call ahead with an order, but we didn't wait long when we just walked in to order. They also have a nice selection of wines, cold beer and soft drinks to add to your meal, along with desserts and salads. Great place. You can dine in too.

title: One of the highlights of our day touring Montepulciano
text: Our tour group of 8 had lunch here before we started wine tasting at the wineries in the piazza. So glad we did. What a delicious meal. I had ravioli with a truffle sauce accompanied by a delicious house white wine. All the pasta dishes were traditional and fresh. A few in our group loved the beef they got. Because we didn't have reservations we couldn't sit on the outside terrace which is high up with gorgeous views, however the inside of the restaurant is lovely with walls lined with lovely bottles of wine. A great choice for a meal when visiting Montepulciano!

title: Beautiful, old world piazza
text: The piazza at the top of Montepulciano is beautiful with gorgeous stone buildings and a beautiful church. Four wineries are tucked into the beautiful buildings and offer wine tastings and tours. The piazza is a lovely place to stroll and sip wine and people watch.

title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Rome
text: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel before taking a train to Tuscany. Our first morning off the plane, we walked to a nearby cafe for breakfast and were able to check in to our room by 11 am...very nice. The staff was very helpful with travel and tour arrangements around town and with restaurant reservations, etc. The bed was wonderful and the room nicely appointed although there were lots of light switches to figure out. The rooftop bar at nice has amazing views, delicious food and great drinks. The breakfast came as part of our reservation and was delicous and fresh. This was a wonderful introduction to Italy.

title: No words can describe this amazing place.
text: a must see up close and inside...the outside lines and ticket hawkers are a bit of a zoo. It's a shame fencing surrounds it. It didn't used to and made for better pictures.

title: One of the most beautiful galleries imaginable
text: We were enchanted by the Borghese Gallery. The ceilings alone are jaw dropping and the sculpture and painting collection feature Bernini, whose Apollo and Daphne is exquisite, while other paitings by Titian, Carravagio, Raphael and DaVinci also delight. The self walking tour is very informative and the quality of the recorded material is excellent. Give yourself 2 hours to listen and see everything. The grounds surrounding the Gallery are picturesque and there are several lovely ponds. The Gallery is renovating the gardens attached to the home which should be lovely once finished. Hope to see it again then.

title: Worth all the great reviews. Great food, atmosphere and wine
text: We went to see the Trevi Fountain, of course, but our other mission upon going there was to find this Prosciutteria after reading such great reviews about it here. It was AMAZING. It's a tiny, quirky place walled with wine bottles whose tables and chairs are boxes...so charming. We found a great place in the back for the 4 of us and ordered a large plank of meats, cheeses, grilled veggies....about !0 Euros per person, great deal and delicious red wine and prosecco too. What they put before us was a work of art...and so delicious. We got there around 6:30 which is early for dinner in Italy and why we were able to get a seat I believe. When we passed by later there was a line outside to get in.

title: Classic, delicious Italian gelato
text: Our Italian tour guide told us this was his favorite place for gelato so we knew it had to be good AND. IT. WAS. FABULOUS. Salted caramel was amazing and I had "a special" that had candied fruit and nuts in it...don't remember the name, but it was perfection. We were there when the doors opened and a line quickly formed. So good. Don't miss it!
place: GROM - Il Gelato come una volta

title: We came looking for a fabulous pizza and found it here.
text: When a number of the locals tell you to try a restaurant, you do it. This outdoor restaurant with a great view of the piazza and beach was so fun, relaxed and delicious. We came for pizza and enjoyed every mouthful...served up with good red wine and proscecco, of course. The limoncello given us after the meal was a nice treat. This place is popular for a reason!

title: Great food, great location, delightful in every way
text: We dined at La Pergola our first night in Positano. We were "hangry" and wanted something simple and Italian, but not pasta, so PIZZA of course. This is probably the best pizza I've had (sorry Tres Sorelle, but you're a close second). Our waiter was friendly and put up with our sad Italian 01 efforts. The prosecco was cold and crisp and the meal was the perfect "first night" in this enchanted sea town. The restaurant is right off the beach near the piazza at the bottom of the many many steps that grace this city in the hill. Beautiful location and fabulous food. Go and enjoy!

title: The perfect end to our stay in beautiful Eden Roc and Positano
text: We saved dinner at our hotel restaurant for our last night in Positano. It was an EVENT. We were seated at 7pm at the front corner table (best in the house it seemed) overlooking lovely the sea...as the sun set and the lights came on on the beach and hillside the view was stunning over the water. For the next 3 hours we relaxingly feasted on the freshest seafood, vegetables and pasta imaginable. When I asked about the daily fish, a sterling silver tray was brought out featuring the fresh catch in all it's lovely, raw glory and I was able to select the dorado I wanted for my meai. We enjoyed beef carpacio, fresh ravioli with the lightest tomato sauce and amazing cheese, the dorado and a delightful tiramisu. The wine and prosecco were delicious. The service was attentive and polite but not intrusive. The three hours we spent here were so special. I would call this a definite MUST if you're visiting Positano.
place: Adamo ed Eva by Eden Roc

title: Beautiful sea view and fresh, local food....great combination!
text: We enjoyed a delicious lunch here while staying in Positano. After around many winding steps and paths we happily came across this restaurant near the "locals beach" and were treated to a table on the vine covered terrace overlooking the sea and beach. It was stunning. We started with caprese salad and and each got pasta. I chose homemade papparedelle pasta with tomatoes and cheese. And my husband got the pasta with puttanesca sauce. The limoncello was delicious, as was the white and red wines we had with our meals. The fish dishes looked amazing...we'll have to go back to try them!

title: The cooking/touring week of a lifetime in belle Tuscany!
text: My husband and I had been planning a trip to Italy for YEARS! We chose September to celebrate his 60th anniversary with a week in Tuscany doing a cooking/sightseeing tour and then a week on the Amalfi Coast. Our week at Villa Schiatti was perfection! Aleen and Grazia and Laura took such excellent care of us all week and chef Mariella taught us to make wonderful Tuscan delicasies...ravioli, octopus stew, Tuscan almond cookies (biscotti) and so much more. The rooms at the Villa are quaint and comfortable with nice hot showers and good mattresses. Lovely breezes blew in at night and there were beautiful sunsets over the olive trees and cypresses. Grazia was so helpful in making almost impossible reservations at the Uffizi and the Accademie. She spent hours on the computer and phone helping us secure the tickets we needed. She also helped us with train tickets and ANY thing else we asked for. We enjoyed talking with her in the evenings...she was learning English and we were learning Italian. Aleen was a wondeful tour guide, sommelier and host in the dining room. He drove us all over Tuscany and was so patient as we asked him to stop the car for photographs in sunflower fields, cypress lined streets and vineyards. He recommended some great wines for us to try during the week (Poliziano!) and he was funny, accommodating and so knowledgeable about everything we toured. He even translated for our cooking lessons with Chef Maria. There were 8 of us on this particular tour and it was the perfect number for dining, touring and socializing with all week. We made new friends and shared so many lovely adventures in Assisi, Montepulciano, Perugia (the Perugina chocolate tour is great!) Siena, and the truffle hunt we went on was so fun and informative. Eating a meal prepared with the truffles the dogs found for us was an added treat at the Boscovino olive oil plant. For our free day we took the train to Florence, thanks to Grazia's help, and came back to the villa that evening for a wonderful gourmet meal. The breakfasts each day were delicious, so much to choose from, and our dinners were excellent...whether we helped cooked them or it was all the chef, the food was fresh, hot and authentically Italian and delicious. Come here and cook and delight in the beauty of the villa and it's grounds and pool and eat "grandmother's cake"....it's life changing! This was a fabulous trip and we can't say enough wonderful things about the staff that served us all week. Gratzie mille!!

title: Perfect place to sit outside and listen to a band and enjoy good food
text: This was my second visit to Island Bar and Grill and the food was very good, as previously. Bang bang shrimp and rare tuna nachos are becoming my favorite things on the menu. There's a great selection of beers on draft, etc. There was a good band and it was a beautiful night to sit outside in the yard. I was solo this time so I kind of got lost on the wait staff's radar and had to look for someone to refill water and get my check, but they were busy so I can see where that can happen. I'll go back for sure.

title: Great beer selection and very tasty food
text: We've visited here twice in the last month, that should tell you something. Great selection of draft beers, cozy seating, nice long bar to sit at if you're just in for a drink. We enjoyed really good burgers and salads. Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the beers and very helpful with the menu too. Gets crowded by 6 on the weekends.

title: Great brisket and super friendly staff
text: This was my first time at Mission BBQ after hearing all my friends rave about it. The staff was super helpful with us "first timers" explaining the difference between the fatty or dry brisket. We got samples of both and it was delicious. The macaroni and cheese is very tasty as are the baked beans and green beans. Cornbread comes with your meal. The place is casual but bright and patriotic in its decor. They have carryout so I know where I'll be getting party food next time.

title: Beautiful quiet hotel right in the heart of the French Quarter
text: We checked in late Friday night and were greeted by friendly staff who settled us in quiet comfortable rooms and proceeded to tell us where to go at midnight to enjoy drinks and music at such a late hour. Bourbon Street was full of drunk 20-somethings and not our style, but we did get to Preservation Music Hall for some great jazz and hurricanes. The hotel bar and cafe served good drinks, coffee and snacks. The concierege staff were very helpful. I'd stay there again.
place: Hyatt Centric French Quarter New Orleans

title: Good music, strong drinks LOTS of people to watch
text: Fun area. We were hoping to hear more jazz than rock and bluegrass, but the bars were entertaining and with so many people decked out in halloween costumes it made for some fun people watching. We didn't here any zydeco in NOLA, which was a real shame. Maybe if we'd come during the jazz festival.

title: beautiful catholic cathedral, lots of history
text: Lovely historic cathedral right in the heart of Jackson square. Beautiful stained glass. It looks especially lovely at night with an illuminated statue of Jesus in the back courtyard.

title: Jazz brunch was the perfect send off from NOLA
text: A local friend made reservations for us at Commander's Palace as soon as she heard we were coming to NOLA and you do need a rez. The massive house was full by 11 am for brunch. Strolling jazz musicians and fabulous food...what's not to love. The oyster and butter nut squash soup was amazing to start, the bread pudding souffle and pecan pie desserts were fabulous. we all have different entrees ranging from pecan crusted fish, a NOLA take on eggs benedict with melt in your mouth pork roast instead of ham, barbecued shrimp and cheesy grits were superb. A must for brunch!
